file_content.text: You lead, I follow, we kill. Let's go.
We've taken the enemy by surprise. Zakuul didn't believe you could organize a resistance on Nar Shaddaa. Frankly, I had my doubts.
Let's finish this. Meet me inside that shield generator's bunker.
We could always use more support, but it's too risky to wait any longer. It's time to move on the shield generator.
I hear you've been busy, Commander. How can I help?
You struck the enemy and drew blood. Even the Hutt Cartel approves of you, although they can't admit it publicly.
Scout the shield bunker. When you get back, we'll talk.
Commander. Lana Beniko sends her regards. She tasked me with coordinating your efforts against the Star Fortress threatening Nar Shaddaa.
We have no business.
I watched the Star Fortress explode. It's one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen.
There's a small fleet loyal to the Alliance sitting on standby at Nar Shaddaa. When you're ready to strike the Star Fortress, they'll provide a distraction.
[Turn in supply crates.]
[Start the Nar Shaddaa Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
[Start a Heroic Mission to secure supply crates.]
[Start an Eternal Empire Champion Duel.]
These are exactly what we need. I'll make sure the right people get them.
That resolution has been a long time coming. Without its distraction, we're much closer to our own victory.
But we need more supplies before we can mount a successful assault on the shield generator.
I'll find the rest of the supplies we need.
The more you find, the more people step forward to help us. We'll win this, yet.
It's time to settle old scores between the Republic, Sith Empire, and Hutt Cartel. Many resources we need are being used up by their conflicts.
I found an opportunity to secure the kinds of things we need. It's worth looking into.
Zakuul has taken note of our efforts. They've stepped up their patrols.
When you have more supplies, I'll be waiting.
You held your end of the bargain, and now I'll hold mine. I pledge myself to you until the Eternal Empire is no more.
That may take a long time.
Then we'll have to pick up the pace. I'll be ready when you need me, Commander.
There's no reason we can't enjoy working together.
I don't mix love and war. It never ends well. But I'll protect you when needed. Until then....
I doubt I'll be calling on you often. You don't seem trustworthy.
I've only stabbed one person in the back, and they deserved it. You don't. But suit yourself, Commander.
If you survive the attack, come find me. I promised I'd stay and help you end this war, but only if you save my home first. Good luck.
There's nothing better than humbling someone who thinks they have all the power. Now Zakuul's hounds know what it feels like to be afraid.
You enjoy striking terror into people a little too much.
Zakuul's enforcers barely qualify as people. They surrendered any claim to that word when they threatened our freedoms.
Not yet, they don't--but they will. I'll see to it personally.
They've earned what's coming.
We can't give them time to regroup. We need to hit the Star Fortress right away.
As much as I love Nar Shaddaa, I promised Lana I would join the Alliance on Odessen and coordinate strikes on the Star Fortress.
I also pledged to serve as your bodyguard should you succeed in destroying it. Seemed the least I could do.
I'm headed for my transport. See you on Odessen, Commander.
But the plan's in motion and there's no holding back. We need to reach the nerve center of this bunker and burn it down.
Lana Beniko ordered me to watch your back in here. Lead the way, Commander.
I'll deliver these last supplies and signal Alliance forces to move in. Find me inside the shield generator.
I don't care who wins. I just want peace and quiet--and gear for our people.
I know where to find one of their elite agents. They tend to be well-equipped. We can turn the enemy's weapons against them.
I have several factions willing to join the Alliance and destroy the Star Fortress, but there are... complications.
The black market has dried up thanks to Zakuul's enforcers. Our allies are willing, but weak. We need to make them strong.
A campaign like ours requires military-grade gear.
Weapons and explosives, definitely. But we also need medpacs, combat stims, droid parts... you name it.
What difference will that make? They're all cannon fodder, anyway.
They aren't an unlimited resource. The better-equipped your "cannon fodder" is, the more likely they'll survive to be useful.
Tell me about these allies. I need to know who's with us.
All of the gangs are contributing foot soldiers. But we have genuine freedom-fighters, too. Evocii. Asylum-seekers. Anti-slavers.
The Republic, Sith Empire, and Hutt Cartel continue their old grudge matches all over Nar Shaddaa.
Settling these pointless fights will focus everyone on the real threat, and gain the resources needed to supply your forces.
Seek out opportunities to gather supplies, and I'll do the same. When you have something, meet me here.
I sense the dark side of the Force within you.
I made no effort to conceal my nature. I was told you are open-minded, for a Jedi.
I see no reason to conceal my true nature from you. But we are not alike.
If I had to guess, I'd say you're some kind of Sith.
Then Lana was correct. You're more than a pretty face. "Some kind of Sith" gets close to the truth, but not quite.
How do you know Lana? Do you work for her?
At the moment, I serve the Alliance. That may continue, depending on how I feel later.
I was training on Korriban when the Eternal Empire's forces attacked. I learned afterward that Arcann and his brother led the invasion.
I had only begun learning the ways of the Force. When my overseer died, I was forced to flee Korriban. This is where I wound up.
It's not too late to seek a different path. I could teach you the Jedi way.
That won't be necessary. I follow my own ways--no one else's.
Join me, and I will complete your training in the dark side.
I have all the training I desire. Seek a new apprentice elsewhere.
So, you aren't a real Sith. Ever consider my line of work? I could show you the ropes.
I'm not seeking employment, and you would find me difficult to train.
Are there other refugees from Korriban hiding on Nar Shaddaa?
We don't have a club, if that's what you're asking. But yes, there are others like me here.
Don't lie to me. Before you entered the Sith Academy, you were a slave. By running away, you became a fugitive of the Empire.
No, I became a fugitive when I decapitated my overseer. I only ran away after that.
You aren't telling me the whole story. I don't like people who keep secrets from me.
My overseer's death was not entirely at the enemy's hands. She was a cruel-hearted woman. No one misses her.
I offer no apologies for what I did to get here. You've seen Korriban. It's where people like me go to die.
Don't be distracted by details. We need each other. It's that simple.
That's why you're helping the Alliance? To get revenge for what happened?
I was happy to escape Korriban. I never looked back. The past doesn't concern me, only the future.
I offered to aid the Alliance because I care about my new home--and I know what happened to Bothawui.
Let's get right to business. Tell me everything you know about the Star Fortress and what it will take to defeat it.
On the surface, it may seem unchanged--but Nar Shaddaa has not been the same since the Star Fortress appeared.
This is no longer a free world for people who want to get lost. Everything that happens here is monitored, recorded, and transmitted back to Zakuul.
Anyone who ventures into the open risks being ID-scanned by Zakuul's agents and taken away without formal charges or a trial.
They must be looking for something--or someone.
And when they find what they're looking for, Nar Shaddaa will no longer have any value. It will become the next Bothawui.
Who are the people being targeted?
There's no clear pattern. They've arrested gangsters, political dissidents, homeless refugees, and even corporate executives with clear records.
I don't know what Zakuul is after, and I don't care--I just want to see this world made safe for everyone.
That's an odd statement coming from a Sith.
These are odd times. I've adapted to them. Can you?
True Sith do not seek safety--or to protect others.
I don't serve dogmatic beliefs. I alone decide what matters.
Agreed--this has to end. Where do we start?
Part of me wants to give Zakuul a little more time to remove the undesirable elements.
And who decides which people are "undesirable?" I escaped being a slave to the Sith Empire. I won't bow to its replacement.
I don't care what's happening here, or why. I just want to destroy the Star Fortress.
The Star Fortress reactor is protected by a shield generator here on Nar Shaddaa. I have the coordinates.
The generator is inside a bunker. Zakuul keeps changing up the security patrols defending its perimeter.
I have a coalition of forces willing to help bring down the Star Fortress, but they need a show of force from the Alliance.
Scout the shield generator's bunker, make a show of eliminating its external defenses, and you'll have the start of an army here.
I don't care who wins. I just want peace and quiet--and gear for our people.
[Turn in Alien Research crate.]
[Turn in Ancient Artifact crate.]
[Turn in Military Equipment crate.]
[Turn in Smuggled Goods crate.]
Taking a break from the mayhem?
There are many here who have known hardship. We understand each other.
The Eternal Empire isn't slowing down, and neither should we.
The Sith here recognize my scars. They know the marks of Korriban.
If the Jedi here had as many warriors as they do opinions, this war would be over.
The galaxy needs this Alliance to succeed. Don't let them down.
I didn't leave one empire to get trampled by another. Let's finish this war.
I'm used to the noise of Nar Shaddaa. It's hard to concentrate here when it's so... quiet.
[Do Nothing.]
[Go Back.]
